comments: Dried up stream. Slope gradually flattened out.  12:49:38
Slow shallow stream with abundant lwd and over hanging veg. Shallow pools with large rocks for fish shelter. 15:04:49
Fished section in outlet pool. Deep and wide section. Undercut banks on both sides.  12:12:24
Turbidity, murky pool with abundant small and large woody debris. Difficult fishing conditions. Lower end of culvert outlet pool. 15:09:08
Lots of green algae in creek, possibly cow shit. Wetted channel starts out wide and narrows farther up. Some undercut present. Shallow stream.  16:05:22
Wide deep pool downstream of lwd debris jam. Approx. 20m from inlet of culvert.  10:01:35
Shallow, riffle pool habitat. Some fish caught hiding in stream substrate. Little to no cover or woody debris in stream. 11:04:26
Small pool by debris jam at bottom end of site where most fish were caught. Rest of site consists of shallow glide. Lightly turbid water conditions. 11:39:43
Glide habitat with abundant boulder cover and cobble stream substrate. 13:38:14
Small pool at top end of site. 14:34:02

Small channel, moderate flowing stream. Medium habitat value. Gravels are predominant substrate in stream, many suitable areas for spawning. Very few deep pools ideal for overwintering. Stream forks approx 200m upstream of culvert. Stream channel is the same size. Big cutblock 50m north of stream, small bridge from block spanning stream near end of survey. Undercut banks are present in most sections of stream.  10:44:37

High habitat value. Wide channel with good flow and abundant cover. Trace areas with gravel patches suitable for spawning. A lot of woody debris protruding into the bankfull channel and adding complexity. Some areas with deep pools suitable for overwintering. Fish spotted in deep outlet pool of culvert.  12:48:01
Shallow pool habitat. Some functional large woody debris at end of site. Stream is moderately turbid. Visibility is relatively low.  11:09:56
Fished one section at bottom of site and one pool under log at top end of site. Middle section was very small and not fishable. 12:15:17
Fished from approx 15m downstream of outlet to the outlet pool. 2 fish caught in pool. Very small channel downstream. Moderate turbidity, hard to see fish. 12:51:52

Fished 4m squared pool at bottom end of site. Stream is very narrow upstream of pool. Another shallow pool under large woody debris was fished upstream, approx 3m squared. A final small 3m squared section near woody debris was fished approx 20n upstream.  14:09:44
Site length 25m long but only 3 small sub sections approximately 4m squared were fished.  The rest of the site length the channel was too small and too much woody debris blocking the stream. 16:39:59
2 fish caught at bottom end of site. 11:17:08
Steep high flowing stream. Some gravel present suitable for spawning.  13:09:28
Steep stream with some smaller cascades with shallow outlet pools. High flow, some patches of gravel present. Abundant overhanging cover. 13:26:55

Steep system with high flow and periodic cascades. Most are less than 1m in height. Very few deep pools (only at cascade outlets) or areas with suitable spawning gravels. Abundant large woody debris over channel and making cascades.  14:25:27

Moderate flowing stream, small channel. Very few areas with good spawning gravels. Few deep pools. Abundant undercut banks providing cover for fish. Woody debris is frequent and often functional and adding complexity. Moderately steep stream but no barriers present. Small fry spotted approx 100m upstream of culvert.  10:41:30
1 pool at top end of site where most fish were caught. Steep valley habitat with small channel 14:15:52
Good flow with periodic shallow pools. 14:26:23
Fished outlet pool. 15:12:35
Small stream channel, approx 20m upstream of inlet. 15:42:11
Small pool at bottom of site with larger fish caught. 15:51:17
One pool at bottom of site with fish caught and one shallow pool at top end of site with fish. Wetted channel is narrower in the middle of site with no fish.  16:35:55
Fished outlet pool, approx 5m squared site. 0.7m deep. 13:05:22
Fished pool below block step approx 0.7m high. 40m ds of pipe. 13:37:42
Shallow riffle pool stream habitat fished just upstream of confluence with Kispiox River.  13:54:30
Shallow riffle pool habitat fished. Wide channel with moderate flow. Approx 10m upstream of inlet. 14:54:07
Wide channel, riffle pool habitat. 15:24:17
Shallow riffle pool, stream gets steeper at top end of site. 15:31:44
Wide channel with moderate flow. Approx 30m downstream of weir. 11:29:05
Approx. 30m downstream of weir. Pool at top end of site. 11:35:16
Directly downstream of weir. Big, deep outlet pool at foot of weir. 11:46:12
Muddy, fine substrate near outlet of pipe. 14:07:03
Shallow riffle habitat near outlet pool. 14:23:29
Fished culvert outlet pool. Approx 0.8m deep and 6m squared. 14:24:18

Riparian vegetation consists of mostly deciduos young saplings. Some older vegetation (alder) present as well creating abundant overhang. Small channel with low flow. Water present throughout 90% of survey, occasional dewatered patches. Fish spotted approx. 500m upstream of culvert (est. 8cm length). Some areas with gravels. Occasional undercut banks. Very few deep pools at time of survey. Gradual slope that stays around 8% throughput surveyed length. 11:21:38

Water present in sporadic pools and brief stretches first 100m. Stream dewaters approx 100m downstream of culvert (waypoint 273). Small channel with some gravels present. Cobbles are predominant stream substrate. Stream flows through steep confined valley. Water flowing in Tagit Creek at confluence. Massive downed trees creating a log jam directly at confluence.  13:31:33

Site is immediately below outlet of pipes to top of first large boulder line. Pool near outlet with steps up to 35 cm. Abundant small weed debris and boulder covered throughout the site.           14:56:55
Slow Gagnon like wetland habitat with steps up to 0.5 m. Abundant algae covering substrate throughout.           13:52:50
Land type habitat with abundant algae throughout. A couple patches of gravel where gradient increases. Not as deep as the first site.           14:20:10
Shallow sight with small gradient breaks of gravel. Predominantly substrate is fines in wetland type area with collapsing banks.           14:38:50
Poor value shallow ruffle habitat with fine substrate. No deep pools or under Cutbanks. No fish captured.           16:15:49
One long pool with steps fairly consistent at 0.3 m very turbid water and large amounts of leaves provided cover on the surface. Many fish captured.           16:32:07
Site is pool were fine substrate and abundant the flitter providing cover. Depths of up to 35 cm throughout. Many fish captured.  No card filled out. Waypoint 293         16:46:58

Moderate value habitat. Approximately 30 m high and 30 m long landslide at edge of clear cut on left bank 300m downstream of top road. Below the landslide sediments have led to sub surface flows with isolated deep pools for a section approximately 300m long.  Abundant gravels throughout. Sparse pools but likely deep enough for overwintering. Fish observed at culvert putlet at top end of site.        10:47:07

Moderate value habitat. Low flow conditions with numerous areas dewatered but generally stream is running throughout area surveyed. Very limited deep pools with depths only to approximately 20 cm. Abundant gravel throughout. Dolly Varden and rainbow captured. Good flow for this time of year on a very dry year.  Waypoint 296.  11:24:38

Moderate value habitat. Abundant gravel throughout. Isolated pools are consistent every 30 to 50 m and up to 55 cm in depth. This is a wetland type fern and alder dominated gully with mature spruce riparian.           12:49:28
Moderate value habitat. Good flow for small system and dry year. Abundant gravels throughout. Undercut banks throughout. Fish known upstream.           15:22:21

Site access at Ford and just below historic sockeye spawning point in FISS. Very nice stream with numerous fry and par observed. Abundant gravelâ€˜s throughout. No noticeably deep pools observed but multiple shallow pools up to 20 or 25 cm present. Good flow for time of year and dry year.
           16:59:44
Moderate value habitat. Abundant gravels present and channel is stable with LWD and SWD throughout. fish captured. Pools are not deep but majority of fish captured there            10:29:22

Moderate value habitat. Upon a gravel is present suitable for dolly Varden spawning. Occasional pools to 0.3 and 0.35m deep. Good flow on dry year. Fish observed downstream in outlet pool. No card filled out. 17:33:59
Moderate value habitat. Lol gradients from bottom of site to Zymoetz  river so likelihood  of natural barrier low. Abundant gravels, suitable for resident and anadromous fish.           18:31:39

Moderate to low value habitat. Stream is mostly dewatered but with isolated pools to 60 cm deep spaced every 30 to 40 m. Stream is entrenched in the valley with large amounts of mobile angular cobbled  substrate throughout. Fish observed in multiple isolated pools up to 300 m upstream of the crossing. No permanent Natural barriers observed.           10:35:09

High vale habitat. Surveyed from Telkwa Hydro to confluence with Wiggs Creek.  Low water levels with sections of stream D watered, particularly in the first 300 m of the survey. Isolated pools scattered approximately 30 to 50 m apart with pools           up to 0.6 m deep. Abundant algae in places of slow, moving water. Failing banks encountered throughout survey with Barbwire fence swapped into the stream at multiple spots. Occasional pockets of gravel present suitable for resident and anadromous salmonids. Conductivity increased from approximately 140 to 230 over the survey links indicating inputs possibly related to cattle use of the area. Extensive trampling within the channel with noted at locations throughout the survey.           10:55:05

High value habitat. Cite covers from confluence of Wiggs           creek to the Bulkley River. Canyon located at proximately 400 m from confluence with the Bulkley. Coho sampled below using dip netting. Canyon - 40m long with two cascade sections 1.5 and 1.7 m high on bedrock may be barrier to anadromous fish under high and low flow conditions.           12:13:53

Moderate value habitat.  Site survey from upper crossing down to lower crossing. Channel is the water beyond approximately 75 m from upstream crossing. Approximately 50m upstream of the road is wetland type area, dominated by willow and sedge. Several fish, approximately 70 mils long were observed in the outlet pool of the upper Crossing. Although, primarily dry, the upper part of the site beyond the wetland area contained abundant gravelâ€™s. Residual pools were dry, except some shallow are ones near the top end of the site when gradients were greater.           10:54:14

Very small site at outlet pool of culvert. One Dolly Varden captured and tagged. Was underneath undercut bank. Conductivity is much higher than stream at culvert located approximately 500 m upstream.           13:42:45
